wikipedia_page.main: John Molyneux (3 February 1931 – 7 March 2018) was an English footballer who played as a right-back.

response: The younger brother of Liverpool and Chester defender John Molyneux,Now & Then, Chester City v Torquay United matchday programme 12/9/98, p 7 Geoff joined Chester as an amateur from Rylands Youth Club in Warrington in 1962. He made his only appearance in The Football League in a 3–1 win over Exeter City (with John also in the side) on 22 September 1962, also playing in a Football League Cup tie with Mansfield Town four days later.
* John Molyneux (academic), British socialist writer and Marxist politician
* John Molyneux (MP for Nottinghamshire) (died 1588), MP for Nottinghamshire
* John Molyneux (MP for Liverpool), in 1584, MP for Liverpool
* John Molyneux (MP for Wigan), represented Wigan (UK Parliament constituency)
* Sir John Molyneux, 1st Baronet (fl. 1605–1640), High Sheriff of Nottinghamshire
* John Molyneux (VC) (1890–1972), recipient of the Victoria Cross
* John Molyneux (footballer) (1931–2018), footballer for Liverpool F.C. in the 1950s

Jones began his career at Second Division club Liverpool, joining as an amateur in April 1955. After two years in the youth team, Jones signed a professional contract in April 1957. He had to wait until 19 December 1959 to make his first team debut, when he deputised for John Molyneux in a 4–0 victory over Cardiff City, a match also notable for the fact that it was Bill Shankly's first in management at Anfield. Jones went on to make only four further appearances for Liverpool (all in April 1963) and he departed the club in August 1963.
* 7 March – John Molyneux, 87, English football player
* c. 7 March 2018: John Molyneux, 72, Chester City and Liverpool right back.
